JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Statistician to The Research and Innovation Centre for Multimorbidity, Slagelse Hospital
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
The Research and Innovation Centre for Multimorbidity is hiring a highly motivated statistician

The science

A unique opportunity to integrate national health data within epidemiology and register based research aiming to:

Identify and characterize patterns and trajectories of chronic conditions and multimorbidity, identify and characterize risk factors, comorbidity patterns and trajectories. Further, develop predictors of treatment response and longitudinal outcomes for multimorbidity patients and estimate the population-valid social and economic impact of multimorbidity and risk factors

The environment
An exciting job in a professional, dynamic and completely informal research environment working with colleagues of various backgrounds including statisticians, physicians, public health researchers, epidemiologists, publishing in high-impact journals, and a leadership supportive of flexible hours to accommodate a good work-life-balance.


The position
Diverse tasks and responsibilities, incl. conceiving research ideas, developing study protocols, data analysis, writing manuscripts etc. in collaboration with both in-house, national and international collaborators. A one-year position with the possibility of extension.

The candidate

We are looking for a motivated and skilled colleague with a PhD degree in the field of statistics.

  • We like our new colleague to be ambitious, curious, and independent, and to appreciate collaboration and teamwork

  • Experienced with epidemiological analyses and methodology and study designs

  • Familiar with statistical programming preferable in R, Stata or SAS

  • Knowledgeable at working with Danish Health and social registers.


The Research and Innovation Center for Multimorbidity
The Research and Innovation Centre for Multimorbidity is located at Slagelse hospital in Region Zealand: the Centre a relationship with the Copenhagen University Hospital through the position held by the director and the lead scientists. Further, the Centre has collaborations with statisticians in Region Zealand and the Technical University of Denmark.

The Center is led by Professor, director Anne Frølich
Contact: Center Director Anne Frølich.

Mobile Phone: +45 27 12 16 22

E-mail: afrol@regionsjaelland.dk
Time frame: Rolling interviews with posting closing on May 20, 2022. The position start at the earliest convenience.



Terms of employment
The place of work is The Research and Innovation Center for Multimorbidity, Slagelse hospital, Region Zealand. We offer salaries in alignment with Danish costs of living that may be supplemented (PhD level) with a reduced tax rate applied to foreign researchers. The position is in accordance with best Danish labor practices, including a 37-hour workweek, six weeks of paid vacation per annum, funded parental leave, matched pension contributions, enrollment in national healthcare, and labor union representation.

All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, disability, nationality, race, religion, or ethnic background are encouraged to apply.
